On 12/8/06, Stephen Smith <steve@...> wrote:
>
> This quest=
ion comes up time and again on this mailing list. For what
> it's worth, I =
think the idea of having a single assertion per test case
> is a noble desi=
gn aim, but it can be tough.


Agreed.  The less asserts the better but sto=
p trying as soon as it starts
feeling unnatural.

Also, I noticed that the =
number of asserts tended to grow as I move from
unit tests to functional te=
sts, which is not very surprising since
functional tests usually have much =
more complex exit criteria than unit
tests.
